titleStmt.title: By the Lords Justices of Ireland. Sydney, Tho. Coningsby. Whereas the wives children and familys, of severall persons in this kingdom; who have been killed in actuall rebellion against their Majestys or are now adhering to the enemyes in their quarters or are fled from the usuall places on their abode, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

titleStmt.title: By the Lords Justices of Ireland. Sydney, Tho. Coningsby. Whereas the wives children and familys, of severall persons in this kingdom; who have been killed in actuall rebellion against their Majestys or are now adhering to the enemyes in their quarters or are fled from the usuall places on their abode, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook assignee of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King and Queens most excellent Majesties; and are to be sold on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: "Given at their Majesties castle of Dublin the 26th day of September 1690,".
Steele notation: Arms 199. this of their.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
